intro: Swainsona novae-zelandiae, commonly known as the New Zealand glory pea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces showy, pea-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange. Its flowers are typically clustered in racemes and bloom from late winter to early spring. The plant is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in coastal and forest margins.
